answers.answer: I am sorry, but I don't know anything about diabetes and pregnancy.  I am sure that your doctors will monitor you and the baby very closly to make sure everything progresses smoothly.  Easy for me to say, don't freak out... but try not to yet.  Has your doctor told you how this has effected your pregnancy?

he didnt say much. hes going to refer me to some specialists for a consult when i asked him if i needed to be scared as far as the baby goes or could this be managed he said he felt that this could be managed  and we just needed to be diligent......i hope hes right and thanks for the comments!

question: ~sigh~ ok. so here we go. im 9 weeks along. have had two health ultra sounds, even heard our little beans heartbeat at 8 weeks via abdominal u/s. everything was good other than about of spotting and low hcg very early on which is now good. I just found out however that I am diabetic. since it is so early, they believe it was mild and pre existing and pregnancy made it explode. My levels after drinking the glucose syrum during the test were crazy high....392 one hour later. I am freaking out. all i read is how since i was untreated and undiagnosed during these 8 weeks my baby is likely to have all kinds of defects. Im terrified. anyone had similar experience and have a healthy birth??
title: diabetes and pregnancy HELP!!!!!!!!!
